cells.data:
## Purpose

This PCR was testing colonies for confirmation of construct and insert. I grew up many different ligations for three species D. Jam, D. mel, D. rufa (12 plates).  **There were only six colonies found in all 12 plates. **  I tested all of them for construct with correct insert.

The primers flank the construct and through the end of the insert.

I then See [Building the Construct](quiver-note-url/5BF88CDB-05C4-454F-9E42-C33415A7B6D1) for more details.

## Samples

Primers: `ES2_confirm_cm` and `Dbir_ES2_R2_cm`

1.  D. jambulina
2.  D. melanogastor 1
3.  D. melanogastor 2
4.  D. rufa 1
5.  D. rufa 2
6.  D. rufa 3

## Program

| step | temp       |  time  |
|------|------------|--------|
| 1    | 95         | 30 sec |
| 2    | 95         | 15 sec |
| 3    | 64         | 1 min  |
| 4    | 72         | 2 min  |
| 5    | 72         | 1 min  |
| 6    | 4          | hold   |


## Results

The reason it is so slight is because it is the bottom of another gel.


![Screen Shot 2016-09-21 at 11.58.07 AM.png](quiver-image-url/F6D244137C0CB3B1C5EE3E756C934641.png)

Looks as though there is construct with presence in all.
